component.name: crypto-cms
component.title: Crypto CMS
component.description: The crypto cms component is used for encrypting data in CMS Enveloped Data format, decrypting CMS Enveloped Data, signing data in CMS Signed Data format, and verifying CMS Signed Data.
component.label: security,transformation

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

envelopedDataDecryptorConfiguration.label: advanced
envelopedDataDecryptorConfiguration.description: To configure the shared EnvelopedDataDecryptorConfiguration, which determines the uri parameters for the decrypt operation.

signedDataVerifierConfiguration.label: advanced
signedDataVerifierConfiguration.description: To configure the shared SignedDataVerifierConfiguration, which determines the uri parameters for the verify operation.

cryptoOperation.description: Set the Crypto operation from that supplied after the crypto scheme in the endpoint uri e.g. crypto-cms:sign sets sign as the operation. Possible values: sign, verify, encrypt, or decrypt.

name.description: The name part in the URI can be chosen by the user to distinguish between different signer/verifier/encryptor/decryptor endpoints within the camel context.

keyStore.label: common
keyStore.description: Keystore which contains signer private keys, verifier public keys, encryptor public keys, decryptor private keys depending on the operation. Use either this parameter or the parameter 'keyStoreParameters'.

keyStoreParameters.label: common
keyStoreParameters.description: Keystore containing signer private keys, verifier public keys, encryptor public keys, decryptor private keys depending on the operation. Use either this parameter or the parameter 'keystore'.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

password.label: decrypt
password.description: Sets the password of the private keys. It is assumed that all private keys in the keystore have the same password. If not set then it is assumed that the password of the private keys is given by the keystore password given in the KeyStoreParameters.

fromBase64.label: decrypt_verify
fromBase64.description: If true then the CMS message is base 64 encoded and must be decoded during the processing. Default value is false.

contentEncryptionAlgorithm.label: encrypt
contentEncryptionAlgorithm.description: Encryption algorithm, for example DESede/CBC/PKCS5Padding. Further possible values: DESede/CBC/PKCS5Padding, AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding, Camellia/CBC/PKCS5Padding, CAST5/CBC/PKCS5Padding.

originatorInformationProvider.label: encrypt
originatorInformationProvider.description: Provider for the originator info. See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5652#section-6.1. The default value is null.

recipient.label: encrypt
recipient.description: Recipient Info: reference to a bean which implements the interface org.apache.camel.component.crypto.cms.api.TransRecipientInfo

secretKeyLength.label: encrypt
secretKeyLength.description: Key length for the secret symmetric key used for the content encryption. Only used if the specified content-encryption algorithm allows keys of different sizes. If contentEncryptionAlgorithm=AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding or Camellia/CBC/PKCS5Padding then 128; if contentEncryptionAlgorithm=DESede/CBC/PKCS5Padding then 192, 128; if strong encryption is enabled then for AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding and Camellia/CBC/PKCS5Padding also the key lengths 192 and 256 are possible.

unprotectedAttributesGeneratorProvider.label: encrypt
unprotectedAttributesGeneratorProvider.description: Provider of the generator for the unprotected attributes. The default value is null which means no unprotected attribute is added to the Enveloped Data object. See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5652#section-6.1.

toBase64.label: encrypt_sign
toBase64.description: Indicates whether the Signed Data or Enveloped Data instance shall be base 64 encoded. Default value is false.

includeContent.label: sign
includeContent.description: Indicates whether the signed content should be included into the Signed Data instance. If false then a detached Signed Data instance is created in the header CamelCryptoCmsSignedData.

signer.label: sign
signer.description: Signer information: reference to bean(s) which implements org.apache.camel.component.crypto.cms.api.SignerInfo. Multiple values can be separated by comma

signedDataHeaderBase64.label: verify
signedDataHeaderBase64.description: Indicates whether the value in the header CamelCryptoCmsSignedData is base64 encoded. Default value is false. Only relevant for detached signatures. In the detached signature case, the header contains the Signed Data object.

verifySignaturesOfAllSigners.label: verify
verifySignaturesOfAllSigners.description: If true then the signatures of all signers contained in the Signed Data object are verified. If false then only one signature whose signer info matches with one of the specified certificates is verified. Default value is true.
